text:
Nigel Pearson emerges as favourite for shock return to Leicester after Claudio Ranieri is sacked Pearson left the King Power under a cloud but is the early contender to succeed the Italian in the hotseat Share Comments By Jacob Murtagh 20:30, 23 FEB 2017 Updated 20:31, 23 FEB 2017 Sport Nigel Pearson is favourite form the Leicester job (Photo: Michael Regan) football Nigel Pearson has emerged as the early frontrunner to become the next Leicester boss.
Foxes chiefs wielded the axe on Claudio Ranieri on Thursday night - just NINE months after the Italian led them to a shock Premier League title.
Pearson left the King Power under a cloud in 2015, despite steering the club to survival.
However, the 53-year-old is the favourite for a surprise return to the King Power Stadium, with Skybet offering odds of 5/1.
Alan Pardew follows at 6/1, with ex-Rangers chief Mark Warburton (10/1) and former Foxes boss Martin O'Neil (12/1) also in the frame.
